alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Wakulla; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 6:34PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Gulf, southwestern Wakulla, southern Liberty and Franklin Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Carrabelle to 8 miles southeast of Wewahitchka. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carrabelle, Sopchoppy, Carrabelle Beach, Beverly, Panacea, Medart, Buckhorn, Liveoak Island, Curtis Mill, Hays Place, Fort Gadsden, Alligator Point, Buck Siding, Morgan Place, Saint Teresa, Turkey Point, Bald Point, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Mcintyre and High Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Wakulla; Liberty
